WYSIWYM.model
Class ContentPlan

java.lang.Object
  WYSIWYM.model.ContentPlan

public class ContentPlan
extends Object

ContentPlan represents a conceptual plan of the feedback text and holds DependencyTrees.

Version:
1.4 2008/07/25
Author:
Feikje Hielkema

Nested Class Summary
protected  class ContentPlan.Paragraph
          Helper class, contains all dependency trees in a paragraph, divided into sentence sets

add

public void add(DependencyTreeTransformer tree,
                String par)
         throws TextPlanningException
Adds a dependency tree to a paragraph

Parameters:
tree - DependencyTree to be added
par - Paragraph header
Throws:
TextPlanningException - if there is no paragraph with this header

add

public void add(List<DependencyTreeTransformer> trees,
                String par)
         throws TextPlanningException
Adds a list of dependency trees to a paragraph

Parameters:
trees - List with DependencyTrees to be added
par - Paragraph header
Throws:
TextPlanningException - if there is no paragraph with this header

newParagraph

public String newParagraph(String header,
                           Anchor anchor)
Creates a new paragraph with the given header. If there already is a paragraph with that header, it will modify the new header. For instance, it might become 'The second interview' instead of 'the interview'.

Parameters:
header - The header of the new paragraph
anchor - Anchor attached to the header (can be null)
Returns:
String The header, which may have changed

addParagraph

public boolean addParagraph(String head,
                            Anchor anchor,
                            List<DependencyTreeTransformer> trees)
Creates a new paragraph with the given header. If there already is a paragraph with that header, it will modify the new header. For instance, it might become 'The second interview' instead of 'the interview'. The list of trees is added to the new paragraph.

Parameters:
head - String with the header of the new paragraph
anchor - Anchor attached to the header (can be null)
trees - List of sentences for the paragraph.
Returns:
String The header, which may have changed

newParagraph

public String newParagraph(List<AnchorString> head)
Creates a new paragraph with the given header. If there already is a paragraph with that header, it will modify the new header. For instance, it might become 'The second interview' instead of 'the interview'.

Parameters:
head - List with the header of the new paragraph
Returns:
String The header, which may have changed

Returns the DependencyTreeTransformers in the paragraph.

Returns:
List of paragraph sentences

getParagraphHeader

public List<AnchorString> getParagraphHeader(String key)
Returns the list of anchorstrings that form that paragraph header

Parameters:
key - Paragraph header
Returns:
List of AnchorStrings with that header

getTrees

public Iterator getTrees()
Returns all trees in the text plan, unordered

Iterator over DependencyTrees
